action.action-desc: Mr. Gosar introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To allow States to authorize State and local law enforcement officers to enforce the provisions of Federal immigration law relating to unlawful entry into the United States.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Empowering States to Deport Illegal Immigrants Act.

section.header: Authorization of State and local law enforcement officers to enforce certain Federal immigration laws

subsection.text: States may authorize State and local law enforcement officers to enforce provisions of Federal immigration law that prohibit the unlawful entry into the United States, including sections 271 through 280 of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1321 through 1330).

subsection.header: Effect of authorization on Supreme Court ruling
subsection.text: Subsection (a) effectively abrogates the 2012 decision of the Supreme Court in Arizona v. United States (567 U.S. 387).

Notwithstanding any other provision of law, State prosecutors are authorized to initiate prosecutions for violations of Federal immigration law referred to in subsection (a) in a United States District Court that has jurisdiction over—

paragraph.text: the place at which any such violation occurred; or
the place at which the person charged for any such violation is apprehended.
